title: Rugby Place-Kick Success Factor Analysis and Simulation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Rugby Rules and Foundational Understanding of Place-Kicking
context.additional_context: Training program for current practitioners (secondary PE teachers/coaches) to understand rugby place-kick success factors via mathematical analysis and apply simulation-based training methods.

learning_goals: Learners can explain 11 key constraints (distance, angle, wind, fatigue, etc.) affecting placekick success in real-game environments.
Simulation tools can be used to mathematically model kicking strategies that incorporate various constraints.
Simulation training designed to replicate game scenarios can improve adaptability to real-world environments by over 20%.

resources: Access to 3D Virtual Kick Training Platform

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
